snippet: Former Vice President Dick Cheney and his wife said the feud pained them, but supported Liz Cheney, whose opposition to same-sex marriage has prompted criticism from her sister, Mary, who has a same-sex spouse.
abstract: Former Vice Pres Dick Cheney and his wife Lynne break silence about public feud between their two daughters, providing political cover for their elder daughter Liz, who is seeking Senate seat in Wyoming; say that it is possible to love a lesbian sister while not embracing idea of gay marriage.
lead_paragraph: Former Vice President Dick Cheney and his wife said the feud pained them, but supported Liz Cheney, whose opposition to same-sex marriage has prompted criticism from her sister, Mary, who has a same-sex spouse.

headline.main: Cheneys Defend Elder Daughter in Feud on Gay Marriage
headline.print_headline: Cheneys Defend Elder Daughter in Feud on Gay Marriage

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
